title: Entertainment Live: 13 March 2015 - BBC News
summary: red nose day kicks off for comic relief .

documents.title: end of the line :
text: that 's all the live news we have for you today .
but we 'll be back on monday with another live page that will have everything you 'll need to know in the world of entertainment , media and the arts .
in the meantime go dermot !
author: Neil Smith
Arts reporter

documents.title: news round-up
text: before we sign off for the day , and the week , here are some other stories we 've been reporting on :

documents.title: back to broadway for chenoweth
text: kristin chenoweth has opened on broadway in musical comedy on the twentieth century , the revival of which has not been without incident .
it was all smiles at thursday 's opening night , and not only because the critics are being kept out until a performance later this week .

documents.title: 'health and safety gone mad '
text: comedian al murray , who is standing for parliament in his guise as the pub landlord , has been forced to cancel a parachute jump - because he is too heavy .
murray was expected to plunge 12,000ft ( 3,658m ) into headcorn aerodrome in kent but learned when he arrived that he was heavier than the 14st 7lb ( 92kg ) limit .
`` my life is being held back by health and safety gone mad , '' he said .
`` gone are the days that a british citizen could throw themselves out of a plane regardless of the risk . ''
murray is contesting the south thanet seat , where he is taking on ukip leader nigel farage in the general election .

documents.title: lee 'delighted ' by book release
text: harper lee 's agent has said the to kill a mockingbird writer is `` in full possession of her mental faculties '' following the
`` we have had wonderful discussions ranging over many subjects from the state of contemporary politics to university life in england , '' continued andrew nurnberg .
`` the fact that she is hard of hearing and suffers from some macular degeneration has no bearing whatsoever on her quick wit or of speaking her mind on all manner of things . ''

the agent said lee , above in 2010 , was `` delighted and enthused '' that go set a watchman is to be published later this year and that any suggestion she was not being looked after was `` as shameful as it is sad '' .

documents.title: clarkson 'grateful ' for support
text: top gear host jeremy clarkson has thanked fans who have supported him since his suspension from the bbc 's motoring show .
`` i am very grateful to everybody , '' said the broadcaster , who is understood to have informed bosses personally of the alleged `` fracas '' that led to his suspension .
news understands that the star phoned the bbc 's head of television , danny cohen , to report the incident .
interviews are expected to be held with the star and other parties next week .

documents.title: scotland welcomes pop art
text: the scottish national gallery of modern art has opened the doors of its
three rooms at edinburgh 's modern one have been given over to the late american who helped define the pop art movement .
this piece , in the car ( 1963 ) , is among the works on display in the free exhibition , which runs until 10 january .
lichtenstein originals can be worth millions , with the auction record set at £ 27.8m in 2012 when

documents.title: on the box
text: gogglebox 's sandra and sandy were among the stars in attendance at the broadcasting press guild awards in london earlier .
the best friends from south london , who are among the channel 4 show 's featured `` tv critics '' , collected the award for best factual programme on behalf of the gogglebox team .
it is the second year in a row it has won the award at the event , organised by journalists who work in the tv and radio industry .

documents.title: 'quite overwhelming '
text: michelle williams has told the bbc she felt `` a responsibility heaped '' upon her when she came to be cast in the film version of irene nerimovksy 's epic novel suite francaise .

undiscovered for 60 years after its author died in a concentration camp , the book - written during the french occupation in the early years of world war two - became a worldwide bestseller upon its publication in 2004 .
`` it 's quite overwhelming , the level of emotion you feel when you even think about irene 's story , '' says williams , above with co-star dame kristin scott thomas .
`` as soon as i read the script , i could see irene , and hear her voice around me .
it very rarely happens , but her words sounded like music to me . ''

documents.title: dermot speaks !
text: i 've just had a brief chat with dermot o'leary as he reaches the home stretch on his 24-hour dance marathon ( and yes , i had to dance with him during the interview ) .
he seems weary , but in good spirits , although his knees are starting to give him trouble .
`` i 'm strictly opposed to going anywhere below knee height now , just in case i do n't get back up , '' he said .
and the star also revealed his family had n't been entirely encouraging about his dancing feat .
`` i spoke to my mum yesterday and she just said to me : 'you know what , you 've never been a natural dancer but i 'm sure you 'll do very well , ' '' he laughed .
`` i was quite nervous anyway , and i 'm thinking , 'thanks a bunch , mum . '
i know i 'm not the greatest dancer in the world , but i 'm not that bad . ''
you can follow dermot 's progress on
author: Mark Savage
Entertainment reporter

documents.title: 'a precious gift '
text: jimmy somerville was on the bbc breakfast sofa earlier , where he revealed how ambivalent he once felt about his distinctive falsetto voice .
`` as i kid i thought it was unmasculine and not very manly , so i was a bit scared of it and hid it away , '' said the former bronski beat and communards singer .
`` but it 's quite a precious gift , and a rare thing for men to have a countertenor voice .
so when we became famous , it was like , 'there 's no turning back now . ' ''
now 53 , the scottish performer has just released homage , his sixth solo album .

documents.title: talbot sentenced
text: former tv weatherman fred talbot has been sentenced to five years in jail for indecently assaulting two boys while working as a teacher .
talbot , who used to work on this morning , was found guilty of abusing two boys at altrincham grammar school in greater manchester during school trips in 1975 and 1976 .
the 65-year-old was cleared of eight other charges of indecent assault , after a three-week trial at manchester minshull street crown court in february .

documents.title: first terry , now geri :
text: geri halliwell has just left bbc hq after helping dermot o'leary with his all-day dancing marathon .
after 20 minutes of dancing she was already looking tired - so how must he be feeling ?
`` i think dermot 's at that stage where you 're beyond tired and the adrenalin just kicks in , '' she says .
`` i think he 's amazing .
i 'm really proud of him . ''
geri first got involved with comic relief when the s girls ' who do you think you are became the official song in 1997 .
`` it 's been a long time ! ''
she laughed .
`` the thing that 's important to remember is that , as well as africa , it 's supporting kids in inner cities in england .
it 's brilliant . ''
author: Mark Savage
Entertainment reporter

documents.title: kane comes home
text: fifty film fans on the west coast of america have paid $ 1,000 ( £ 675 ) each to watch orson welles ' 1941 classic citizen kane in the home of the man who partly inspired it .
the special screening will take place later in the private movie theatre that us tycoon william randolph hearst built at his hearst castle residence at san simeon , california .
welles based the character of newspaper magnate charles foster kane on hearst , whose home became the fictional xanadu in the film .
hearst 's great-grandson stephen hearst said he had agreed to allow the event -
if you ever get the chance to visit

documents.title: superhero surprise
text: the touching moment robert downey jr presented a working prosthetic arm that looks just like iron man 's to a seven-year-old boy has been documented on
alex , who was born with a partially developed right arm , was surprised by downey jr - dressed as superhero tony stark - with the red and gold prosthetic that had been developed especially for him .
the arm was created by engineering student albert manero , who builds and donates 3d-printed bionic limbs to children around the world as part of

documents.title: smith and jones recognised
text: sheridan smith and toby jones are being recognised by the broadcasting press guild at its annual awards bash , for dramas that saw them both play real people .
smith , 33 , has won best actress for her performances as the young cilla black in itv 's cilla and as claire webster , whose murder by husband malcolm was dramatised in the widower .
jones , meanwhile , is being honoured for playing football kitman neil baldwin , the subject of bbc two 's marvellous , as well as for his role in the sitcom detectorists .
marvellous has won best single drama at the london event , while the honourable woman is the recipient of the guild 's drama series prize .

documents.title: three dog night 's greenspoon dies
text: `` jeremiah was a bull frog , was a good friend of mine .
i never understood a single word he said , but i helped him drink his wine . ''

if those lyrics from three dog night 's joy to the world ring a bell , you 're sure to be saddened by the news that jimmy greenspoon , the rock band 's long-time keyboardist , has died of cancer at the age of 67 .
greenspoon joined the band - who also scored a hit with their cover of mama told me ( not to come ) - in 1968 and remained with them until october last year .
during his long career , he also performed with eric clapton , jimi hendrix and the beach boys .

documents.title: dermot does the floral dance
text: dermot o'leary has been joined by a special guest outside the bbc 's broadcasting house - no less a great than sir terry wogan .
sir terry gave a boost to dermot 's 24-hour dance marathon for comic relief by performing a jovial , if not always tuneful rendition of the floral dance .

documents.title: it has bean
text: rowan atkinson 's mr bean is just one of the favourites set to take part in this year 's comic relief appeal , which kicks off on bbc one at 19:00 gmt .

dawn french 's vicar of dibley , little britain 's lou ( played by david walliams ) and james bond stars daniel craig and sir roger moore will also be seen in sketches alongside a host of special guests .
it 's all for charity of course , with organisers setting their sights on topping 2013 's whopping total of £ 100m .

documents.title: clapton plans birthday celebration
text: eric clapton will mark his impending 70th birthday by playing
clapton , who turns 70 on 30 march , will play the new york venue on 1 and 2 may .
he first performed there with cream in 1968 ( this is him in that year ) and has revisited it 46 times .
this time slowhand will be accompanied by his band , which includes paul carrack , steve gadd and nathan east .

documents.title: obama 'looking grayer these days '
text: us chat show host jimmy kimmel has invited any number of famous celebrities to `` read mean tweets '' about themselves on his late night programme .
but he 's outdone himself this week by getting president obama himself to take part in this hugely popular segment .

documents.title: itv goes scandi-noir
text: itv has bought the rights to hit scandi-noir drama jordskott , which centres on the mysterious disappearance of a police detective 's daughter .
the series , which stars gwyneth paltrow-alike moa gammel , will be shown on itv encore , the drama-dedicated channel only available to sky and now tv audiences .
jayne redpath , of itv global entertainment , said : `` jordskott 's stunning backdrop in a swedish forest brilliantly sets the scene for this mysterious thriller of loss , grief and love .
`` these universal themes and beautiful production values make it perfect for an international audience . ''

documents.title: henry honoured
text: the broadcasting press guild awards take place in london today , so we 'll be bringing you the winners later .
however , we already know that comedian lenny henry is to receive a special accolade for his outstanding contribution to broadcasting .

`` no one has done more in recent years to speak out against what he calls the 'appalling ' lack of diversity in broadcasting , '' said bpg guild 's chairman gideon spanier , who also saluted the 56-year-old 's sterling work for comic relief .
previous winners of the award include sir terry wogan , cilla black , melvyn bragg and sir david frost .
the bpg awards , voted for by journalists who write about tv and radio , will be handed out at the theatre royal drury lane around noon .
it 's also been announced that lenny will host the olivier awards next month .

documents.title: emmy role for andy
text: andy samberg may not be that well-known in the uk , but over in the us he 's one of the biggest stars on television .
small wonder , then , that he 's been lined up to host the primetime emmy awards in september , following in the footsteps of last year 's host seth meyers , another saturday night live stalwart .
if you 've seen samberg at all , it 's probably thanks to his e4 sitcom brooklyn nine-nine , for which he won a golden globe in 2014 , or the bbc two sitcom cuckoo (

the 36-year-old - seen at the oscars last month co-performing everything is awesome from the lego movie - promises the emmys would be `` a wild ride '' and advised viewers to `` buckle their seat belts '' .

documents.title: griffin departs fashion police
text: kathy griffin has quit her role on e !
's fashion police after filming just seven episodes .
hired to replace her friend , the late joan rivers , griffin announced her departure on twitter , saying she had realised her style does n't fit with the creative team .
she
e !
said the show would continue despite the departure of griffin and kelly osbourne , who left two weeks ago in the wake of a

documents.title: kee-eee-eep dancing
text: broadcaster dermot o'leary is now 14 hours into his 24-hour comic relief
strictly co-host claudia winkleman , weather forecaster carol kirkwood and arsenal legend thierry henry are just a few of those who have been helping him on his way .
with any luck we 'll be chatting to him later .
in the meantime ,

documents.title: more mr selfridge on the way
text: given it 's now been sold to more than 150 countries worldwide , it 's no surprise to learn that itv has commissioned a fourth series of its lavish period drama mr selfridge .
jeremy piven will reprise his role as harry selfridge in the 10-episode season , which will also see katherine kelly ( above with piven ) return as socialite lady mae loxley .
the fourth series , we are told , focuses on harry 's `` dramatic fall '' as he `` loses hold on the empire and social status that he worked so hard to create '' .
line of duty actor sacha dhawan is set to join the cast .

documents.title: 'irreverence and creativeness ' :
text: crime writer val mcdermid has been paying tribute to the late sir terry pratchett 's `` irreverence and creativeness '' following his death on thursday at the age of 66 .
`` nothing was beyond his powers of imaginations , '' she said .
`` he made you look at the world around you differently .
`` when he started there was no humour or women in fantasy , but he gave us a whole array of women .
he painted this wide canvas of all sorts of people . ''
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: get in touch :
text: have you got something to say or something you want to tell us about ?
let us know by tweeting
author: Keily Smith
Entertainment reporter

documents.title: ahead by a nose :
text: it 's red nose day , which means we 'll be bringing you plenty of comic relief news as the clock ticks down to tonight 's live fundraising telethon .
we 'll also bring you the winners of this year 's broadcasting press guild awards , plus lots of other bulletins from the world of arts , entertainment , media and culture .
so stick with us - you nose it makes sense !
author: Neil Smith
Arts reporter
